statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: David Efianayi scored 21 points on 10-for-16 shooting and Tyrell Nelson added 15 points to lead Gardner-Webb past Charleston Southern 79-75 on Saturday.
article.headline: Gardner-Webb takes out Charles Southern 79-75
article.story: BOILING SPRINGS, N.C. -- David Efianayi scored 21 points on 10-for-16 shooting and Tyrell Nelson added 15 points to lead Gardner-Webb past Charleston Southern 79-75 on Saturday. Charleston Southern's Armel Potter hit a layup and a jumper to bring the Buccaneers to 74-73 with 2:05 to play. Efianayi then made a layup with 1:17 to go and the Gardner-Webb (8-8, 1-2 Big South) held on. Cortez Mitchell gave the Buccaneers a 23-14 lead with 11:46 before halftime before Gardner-Webb went on a 17-6 run, and Efianayi's layup gave the Bulldogs their first lead of the game at 31-29. Gardner-Webb led 42-38 at intermission and then outscored 13-6 Charleston Southern after the break 13-6 for a 55-45 lead on Tyrell Nelson's layup. Laquincy Rideau added 14 points, nine rebounds, and nine assists for the Bulldogs. Mitchell scored 18 points on 7-for-10 shooting and Armel Potter and Jamal Thomas each scored 16 points for Charleston Southern (4-11,0-4).
